AboutMe:
Programmer since the good old, bad old days of punch cards. You name it, I've probably bashed against it - or at least ran away screaming: "Dot Net is Coming ! Dot Net is Coming !"

I do some technical writing, editing, and translate German to English. I also do design work in electronics, art, and (building) architecture.

- Architecture: project and topology planning, systems assessments.
- Server-side: web services, middleware, systems integration.
- Client-side: Mobile, web, and desktop client GUIs, middle-to-top tier integration.

Know > 30 programming languages: 10 pretty good, 5 as expert. Favorites: Python, C/C++, Java, Objective-C [ yes, I really do like it ], ASP (the good old, not.net kind), PHP, Bash, and the sweetest little language since Ruby and just before Boo: IO. { Sorry, Bill, but I don't like Anything.Net ( Well, OK, I'll do C# if you pay me really well :) }

Favorite IDE's / Editors: Eclipse, UltraEdit, and really a cool one: Sublime. Recently started using Android Studio (JetBrains) - very nice!

Pet Projects: Anything mathematical or astronomical, Ham Radio, CUDA coding, and learning Python Mods for Apache. Anything philosophical - including discovering the true nature of those mysterious beings we call cats.

... always open for contract work ...

thanks for checking in on me !

And, yes, the BitBucket really is in Hoboken, New Jersey.
